answers.answer: Your pain sounds atypical for coronary artery disease, and it most likely is musculoskeletal, however, without any additional information, such as your age, sex, smoking history, high blood pressure, cholesterol, diabetes and family history of early CAD, it is hard for me to make any further recommendations.  The fact that you get short of breath with the chest pain is slightly worrisome, however, that could also be due to some anxiety.  If you are still having these symptoms I think you should probably seek medical attention right now because it is worth taking any risks.  If the symptoms are gone, you could see a physician within a few days, maybe next week.

question: I have recently had a few times where my chest pains wake me up. It is as if something is tighening up in my chest, i can barely sit up when it happens and for a few days after ward my chest feels as if i pulled muscles in it. The pain is centrally located in th middle of the breast. I become short of breath and i feel weak. any suggestion, no innsurance only go to the doctor when i am afraid.
title: chest muscle pain
